label: Bug-1
title: issues-fs list returns empty despite issues existing on disk
description:
Running 'issues-fs list' in any repo returns 'No issues found' and 'issues-fs types list' returns 'No node types defined', even when .issues/data/ contains issue folders with valid issue.json files and .issues/config/node-types.json has valid type definitions. The _index.json correctly reports total_nodes counts.

Affects all repos in the ecosystem. Critical blocker for Conductor cross-repo scanning.

Likely a path resolution or config loading issue in the CLI when reading from the .issues/ directory.

Reproduction:
1. Run 'issues-fs init' in any repo (creates .issues/ with config and types)
2. Manually verify .issues/config/node-types.json has types defined
3. Run 'issues-fs types list' -> returns 'No node types defined'
4. Run 'issues-fs create bug test' -> returns 'Error: Unknown node type: bug'
5. In repos with existing issues (e.g. Issues-FS__Service__UI with 12 issues), 'issues-fs list' returns 'No issues found'

Environment: issues-fs-cli v0.2.0, issues-fs v0.4.0, Python 3.12
